title: Designing Metacognition-Based Industrial Electronics Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Basic electrical/electronic theory and foundational circuit design skills
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service teachers to strengthen vocational school industrial electronics education competencies, featuring asynchronous learning environments utilizing digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can explain the basic components and operating principles of industrial electronic systems
Learners can analyze complex electronic circuits using metacognitive strategies (self-monitoring, goal-setting, reflection)
Learners can apply metacognitive thinking when solving electronic design problems with peers using collaborative tools in LMS
Learners can identify learning gaps and develop improvement plans through formative assessment analysis

resources: LMS Platform (Discussion Board, Quizzes, Collaboration Tools)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
